content: Edward Lank Edward Lank home research publications teaching hci lab A note from the Cheriton School of Computer Science We are saddened to say that Professor Edward Lank passed away on March 21, 2022 at the age of 49. Please see the in memoriam for our tribute to him and details about his personal and academic life. Ed's faculty profile on the Cheriton School of Computer Science website has been preserved for historical interest. Please see https://cs.uwaterloo.ca/people-profiles/edward-lank About Me I am a professor and Cheriton Faculty Fellow in the Cheriton School of Computer Science at the University of Waterloo. My research is in the area of Human-Computer Interaction (HCI). In particular, my research focuses on: Intelligent User Interfaces Mobile, Multi-Touch, and Free-space Gestural Interaction Movement and Input Modeling in Interfaces Alongside my appointment at the University of Waterloo, I am currently (2019 - 2023) an Inria International Research Chair attached to Ã‰quipe LOKI at Inria Lille-Nord Europe in Villeneuve d'Ascq, France. If I am not at Waterloo, you can frequently find me (and my students) in Lille, France. My current research projects page is somewhat out of date, but you can see how I spend my time by browsing my Google Scholar page, linked at the top of this page from Publications (Publication venue rankings are available here). If you think you might be interested in working with me, read this first. Edward LankProfessor Cheriton School of Computer Science University of Waterloo 200 University Ave. W.
